class.name: Vector2D

javadoc.text:
This class represents a 2D vector. *

Instances of this class are guaranteed to be immutable.
A vector with all coordinates set to NaN.
A vector with all coordinates set to positive infinity.
A vector with all coordinates set to negative infinity.
Simple constructor. * Build a vector from its coordinates
Simple constructor. * Build a vector from its coordinates
javadoc.exception: DimensionMismatchException if array does not have 2 elements

javadoc.text: Multiplicative constructor * Build a vector from another one and a scale factor. * The vector built will be a * u
Linear constructor * Build a vector from two other ones and corresponding scale factors. * The vector built will be a1 * u1 + a2 * u2
Linear constructor * Build a vector from three other ones and corresponding scale factors. * The vector built will be a1 * u1 + a2 * u2 + a3 * u3
Linear constructor * Build a vector from four other ones and corresponding scale factors. * The vector built will be a1 * u1 + a2 * u2 + a3 * u3 + a4 * u4
Get the abscissa of the vector.
Get the ordinate of the vector.
Get the vector coordinates as a dimension 2 array.

Compute the distance between two vectors according to the L2 norm. *

Calling this method is equivalent to calling: * p1.subtract(p2).getNorm() except that no intermediate * vector is built
javadoc.return: the distance between p1 and p2 according to the L<sub>2</sub> norm

javadoc.text:
Compute the distance between two vectors according to the L∞ norm. *

Calling this method is equivalent to calling: * p1.subtract(p2).getNormInf() except that no intermediate * vector is built
javadoc.return: the distance between p1 and p2 according to the L<sub>∞</sub> norm

javadoc.text:
Compute the square of the distance between two vectors. *

Calling this method is equivalent to calling: * p1.subtract(p2).getNormSq() except that no intermediate * vector is built
javadoc.return: the square of the distance between p1 and p2

javadoc.text:
Test for the equality of two 2D vectors. *

* If all coordinates of two 2D vectors are exactly the same, and none are * Double.NaN, the two 2D vectors are considered to be equal. *

*

* NaN coordinates are considered to affect globally the vector * and be equals to each other - i.e, if either (or all) coordinates of the * 2D vector are equal to Double.NaN, the 2D vector is equal to{@link #NaN}. *
javadoc.param: other Object to test for equality to this
javadoc.return: true if two 2D vector objects are equal, false if * object is null, not an instance of Vector2D, or * not equal to this Vector2D instance

javadoc.text:
Get a hashCode for the 2D vector. *

* All NaN values have the same hash code.
javadoc.return: a hash code value for this object

javadoc.text: Get a string representation of this vector.
javadoc.return: a string representation of this vector
